summary: This bill, known as the "GUARD Veterans’ Health Care Act," primarily focuses on amending Title 38 of the United States Code to allow the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to recover costs from Medicare Advantage and Medicare prescription drug plans for healthcare services provided to veterans. It also modifies the VA's authority to recover charges for care related to non-service-connected disabilities, clarifying the recovery process and imposing penalties for non-compliance by third parties. The bill defines “clean claim” and elaborates on third-party responsibilities regarding reimbursements.
